examples: 95 per cent of the UK can now get superfast broadband.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Get a load of that dress Mag!
Get a load of George over there.
The police got wind of the illegal drug deal.
words.defineEn: to receive or come to have something
words.defineVi: để nhận hoặc đến để có một cái gì đó

examples: The Siemens display goes the whole hog.
The cruise went very quickly.
My laptop went haywire
To go swimming/fishing/jogging.
The email went to everyone in the company.
words.defineEn: to travel or move from one location to another location
words.defineVi: để đi du lịch hoặc di chuyển từ một địa điểm đến một địa điểm khác

examples: That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
The hotel had expensive rates during the holiday season.
The group has a new CD in the pipeline.
The police had the situation well in hand.
The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season.
words.defineEn: to hold, possess, or own an object or a quality
words.defineVi: để giữ, sở hữu, hoặc sở hữu một đối tượng hoặc một chất lượng

examples: To turn cartwheels/somersaults.
To save a penalty.
To play the piano/violin/flute.
To call a meeting/strike.
To have a meeting/a party/a concert.
words.defineEn: used to say where someone or something goes
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói nơi một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó đi

examples: She shares her eraser with her classmates during exams.
I always get the jitters before exams.
I always get butterflies before an exam.
You may turn over your exam papers now.
It's an easy exam.
words.defineEn: a way of testing how much someone knows about a subject
words.defineVi: một cách kiểm tra xem ai đó biết bao nhiêu về một chủ đề

examples: The closed window blocked out the noise from the street.
The dishwasher is making a strange noise.
The sudden noise made her start.
Local residents have raised concerns about late-night noise.
The constant noise from the construction site vexed the residents of the neighborhood.
words.defineEn: sounds that are usually unwanted or loud
words.defineVi: âm thanh thường không mong muốn hoặc lớn

examples: My father has brown eyes.
The woman has eyes like a hawk!
A vase on a side table caught his eye.
The actor's intense bedroom eyes added an extra layer of allure to his performance.
The intense gaze from across the room, eyes on stalks, left no doubt about his attraction.
words.defineEn: a body part on our face that we have two of and use for seeing
words.defineVi: một bộ phận cơ thể trên khuôn mặt của chúng ta mà chúng ta có hai và sử dụng để nhìn

examples: He was given a new heart in a five-hour operation.
I have to go to hospital for an operation.
Failing to properly maintain the equipment could spell disaster for the entire operation.
Dr Bailey is doing the operation, so your wife is in safe hands.
The ship's crew worked together to ensure the smooth operation of the vessel.
words.defineEn: an organized activity involving multiple people doing various things to achieve a common goal
words.defineVi: một hoạt động có tổ chức liên quan đến nhiều người làm những việc khác nhau để đạt được một mục tiêu chung

examples: The soldiers kept the attackers at bay.
Suddenly another soldier hits the dirt beside me.
The new soldiers had no stomach for a fight.
The tomb is guarded day and night by soldiers.
We must strike now that they are down to only a handful of soldiers!
words.defineEn: someone who serves in an army, particularly a person who is not an officer
words.defineVi: một người phục vụ trong quân đội, đặc biệt là một người không phải là một sĩ quan

examples: The twentieth century saw dramatic changes in most areas of life.
Mrs. Thatcher held the post of prime minister longer than anyone else last century.
The ancient castle has stood for over a century, preserving its grandeur and history for hundreds of years.
This charming cottage dates back to the 15th century and is as pretty as a picture, with its thatched roof and secluded garden.
In the early 20th century, a respected woman in high society dramatically came down in the world if she got divorced.
words.defineEn: a period of one hundred years
words.defineVi: khoảng thời gian một trăm năm

examples: My knowledge of French is pretty basic.
The girls looked so pretty in their summer dresses.
The board meeting painted a pretty grim picture.
Those movie stars live pretty high off the hog.
Years of war have left their mark on these pretty islands.
words.defineEn: (of a woman or a child) attractive without being very beautiful
words.defineVi: (của một người phụ nữ hoặc một đứa trẻ) hấp dẫn mà không quá xinh đẹp

examples: he shaved his beard off.
Enhance the flavor of your dishes by shaving truffle over scrambled eggs for a luxurious breakfast.
I will play Juliet, as soon as I shave my beard.
When Andy started losing his hair, he decided to shave it all off.
Don't criticize the new intern so harshly, remember the saying - a barber learns to shave by shaving fools.
words.defineEn: to remove hair, particularly facial hair, with a razor
words.defineVi: để tẩy lông, đặc biệt là lông mặt, bằng dao cạo

examples: My friends enjoyed tangy barbecue gammon skewers at the summer barbecue.
The children enjoyed a refreshing slice of watermelon on a hot summer day.
My friends enjoyed smoky beef rib chops at the countryside barbecue.
My vegetarian friend enjoyed a nourishing adzuki bean grain bowl for lunch.
The hiker enjoyed the scenic beauty of the river's gentle bends.
words.defineEn: to take pleasure or find happiness in something or someone
words.defineVi: để có niềm vui hoặc tìm thấy hạnh phúc trong một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó
